definition: to live one's life/to make a living
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
have a smoke after each meal and you will surpass the immortals (proverb)
pinyin: fan4 hou4 yi1 zhi1 yan1 , sai4 guo4 huo2 shen2 xian1
containing_words.word: 饭后一支烟，赛过活神仙

sentences.english: We c't all live on laxatives.
sentences.chinese: 我们又不用靠泻药过活。

sentences.english: He studied gastronomy but cannot make a living as a cook.
sentences.chinese: 他学习了烹饪但却无法靠厨艺过活。

sentences.english: James lived on without begging alms from others.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯没有向别人乞求周济照样过活。

sentences.english: Initial investigations into the source of her infection suggest exposure at a live bird market.
sentences.chinese: 感染源初步调查显示，病人曾到过活禽市场。

sentences.english: Gamblers and confidence men prey on Jack and many of his friends.
sentences.chinese: 赌棍和骗子常靠骗取杰克及其许多朋友的钱财过活。

sentences.english: And the handsome young men must have something to live on as well as the plain.
sentences.chinese: 英俊的男人和相貌平常的男人一样都得得靠钱过活啊。

sentences.english: Both bore languidly the indefinable burden of immaterial pleasures. Thus lived these somnambulists who are called lovers.
sentences.chinese: 这两个所谓情人的梦游病患者便是这样过活的。

sentences.english: 3 years later, this factory closed down, I began to set up temporary stalls.
sentences.chinese: 3年后，这家工厂倒闭了，于是我开始摆小摊子过活。

sentences.english: He made his living by scalping tickets to the baseball game.
sentences.chinese: 他就靠倒卖棒球观赛票来过活。

sentences.english: He who depends on others dines ill and sups worse.
sentences.chinese: 靠人过活，午饭不好，晚饭更差。

sentences.english: On these fifteen hundred francs these two old women and the old man subsisted.
sentences.chinese: 两个老妇人和老头儿都在那一千五百法郎里过活。

sentences.english: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
sentences.chinese: 靠着希望过活，至死都会饿肚皮。

sentences.english: It was fun, but you could never make a living from it.
sentences.chinese: 它充满乐趣，但你别想靠它过活。

sentences.english: Yet the complexity of the prediction apparatus must not overwhelm the vivisystem itself.
sentences.chinese: 可是，预测机制的复杂性绝不能盖过活系统本身。

sentences.english: Going to college and just trying to live his life, you know.
sentences.chinese: 他去上大学，也在努力地过活。

definition: to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
barren field/poor land
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to give material assistance to
to make a living
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
to farm/to work the land
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
